title: Don't Believe What Consumers Say When It Comes to Sustainability - The Business of Fashion
summary: Despite surveys indicating increasing consumer preference for sustainable fashion, actual consumer behavior shows a significant gap between intentions and actions, leading to continued support for fast fashion brands like Shein. Factors contributing to this gap include poorly constructed surveys, intention versus action gaps, an ill-defined concept of sustainability in fashion, vested interests of survey authors, and a flawed premise that buying more sustainable fashion products will lead to a more sustainable planet.
